tags.name: Contentful
tags.description: Perform operations using the Contentful connector.

post.summary: Upload file to file storage synchronously
post.description:
Upload file synchronously to the file storage. The file is saved and can be retrieved by sending a GET request to this endpoint.
The returned ID can be used as a parameter for uploading files to third party systems or for file conversion.
The file will be deleted after 1 day.

X-ActionId.description:
A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

parameters.name: X-ActionId
parameters.description:
A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

parameters.name: X-ResponseType
parameters.description:
Specify if the response should contain the processed object itself in an application/octet-stream body,
or a application/json body with an ID that can be then used to retrieve the object using a /load-content endpoint.
Note that for larger files (> 1 MB), it is advised to use the ID option which is also default.

200.description:
Successful operation. If X-ResponseType is set to 'ID' or no value is sent in the header, the file is saved and can be retrieved by sending a GET request to this endpoint.
If X-ResponseType is set to 'OBJECT', the file is returned as a stream.

X-ActionId.description:
A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

post.description:
Download raw content synchronously from Contentful without modifications from the connector.
This endpoint is useful if you require maximum flexibility in working your data.

parameters.name: X-ActionId
parameters.description:
A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

parameters.name: X-Webhook
parameters.description:
Webhook URL is used in asynchronous endpoints. Once the request is processed, the response will be sent to this URL in a POST request.
If this value not sent, an ID will be returned in the response and later used to retrieve the response using a GET call on the endpoint.

200.description:

post.description:
Generates an access token from a developer token. A developer token is a unique identifier that is used to authenticate the user.
You can generate it in your Phrase profile. Go to the Dashboard -> Settings -> Profile -> Access tokens.

get.summary: Download file from file storage synchronously
get.description: Download file synchronously from the file storage.

X-ActionId.description:
A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

get.description: Returns all Bifrost-compatible connectors you have configured.

X-ActionId.description:
A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

A logging ID of the request. It is propagated through Phrase systems, making it easier to connect logs from various services.
If no ActionId is sent with a request, one will be generated by Bifrost and returned with the response.

ContentfulCredentials.description:
Two Contentful API access tokens: one for the preview API and one for the management API.
You can alternatively provide a connectorUuid if the connector is already created in Phrase TMS.

ContentfulPath.description: Path to the contentful entry where the file should be uploaded/downloaded

connectorUuid.description:
UUID of the connector (corresponds to localToken).
Can be used as an alternative to contentfulCredentials if the connector is already created in Phrase TMS.
Connector configuration in Phrase TMS is ignored, only the credentials are used.  Provide a specific configuration in the configuration field.

storageId.description: ID of the stored raw file you want to upload to Contentful

connectorUuid.description:
UUID of the connector (corresponds to localToken).
Can be used as an alternative to contentfulCredentials if the connector is already created in Phrase TMS.
Connector configuration in Phrase TMS is ignored, only the credentials are used.  Provide a specific configuration in the configuration field.

storageId.description: ID of the stored raw file you want to upload to Contentful

connectorUuid.description:
UUID of the connector (corresponds to localToken).
Can be used as an alternative to contentfulCredentials if the connector is already created in Phrase TMS.
Connector configuration in Phrase TMS is ignored, only the credentials are used.  Provide a specific configuration in the configuration field.

UUID of the connector (corresponds to localToken).
Can be used as an alternative to contentfulCredentials if the connector is already created in Phrase TMS.
Connector configuration in Phrase TMS is ignored, only the credentials are used.  Provide a specific configuration in the configuration field.

UUID of the connector (corresponds to localToken).
Can be used as an alternative to contentfulCredentials if the connector is already created in Phrase TMS.
Connector configuration in Phrase TMS is ignored, only the credentials are used.  Provide a specific configuration in the configuration field.

storageId.description: ID of the stored XLIFF file you want to convert

webhookUrl.description: Webhook URL you supplied in the request

requestId.description: Request ID you can use to retrieve the result

developerToken.description:
A developer token is a unique identifier that is used to authenticate the user.
You can generate it in your Phrase profile. Go to the Dashboard -> Settings -> Profile -> Access tokens.

Authorization.description: Authorization token. The value is received by using the /authenticate endpoint. Example: OLi6jKa0VVyJqC5Ojv5LH2myTckP5N8Eb0rrWvdTOxCkJjT14E1AEj63bvzZ7CKM5
Authorization.name: Authorization
